comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: May 28, 1914 was the date of the annual garden party at Governors Island. See NYT of May 29, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B05E0D8173AE633A...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
The occasion for this photo was an annual event on Governors Island, the lawn party of the Army Relief Society. The party was a fundraiser for the organization, which provided succor to widows and orphans of officers and enlisted men of the Regular Army.

The Bain agency's photographer also recorded the May 25, 1911, party, which was hosted by General Frederick Dent Grant, the son of U. S. President Ulysses S. Grant. Frederick Grant at that time was the resident officer on Governor's Island, but he died a year later (of cancer), on April 12, 1912.

Here is Fred Grant with Secretary of War Henry L. Stimson, at the 1911 shindig:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163471766/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
